itemDescription: Garnett [née Hart], Elizabeth (1839–1921), missionary to navvies and author

wikipedia_page.main: Elizabeth Garnett (23 September 1839 – 22 March 1921) was a British missionary to navvies and an author. She was a founder and leading force of the Navvy Mission Society.

response: *Elizabeth Garnett, missionary to navvies and author, was born in 1839 in Otley and did much to improve the life of the navvies working in the area.

The reservoir was built by navvies between 1869 and 1876. In about 1872 Elizabeth Garnett was moved by the living conditions of the workers and their families who were camped here building this reservoir. She opened a Sunday School at the site and within a year she resolved to move to the camp. She was joined in her work by the Reverend Lewis Moule Evans and together they founded was known as the "Navvies Mission".
